title: Select residual plot to allow regression inference

content.question: The residual plots from five different least squares regression lines are shown below. Which of the plots provides the strongest evidence that its regression line is an appropriate model for the data and is consistent with the assumptions required for inference for regression?

choices.label: Choice A is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice A form a U-shape.

Choice B is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice B form an inverted V-shape.

Choice C is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice C are evenly spread out horizontally, and evenly spread out in the region between negative 2 and 2 vertically.

Choice D is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice D are evenly spread out horizontally, however they extend from negative 2 to 2 on the left and get steadily narrower so that they are confined by negative 1 and 1 on the right.

Choice E is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice E are evenly spread out horizontally, however they start at 0 on the left and get steadily wider so that they eventually take up all of the vertical space on the right.

content.answer: Choice C is a scatter plot with resides on the vertical axis from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1, and X on the horizontal axis from 0 to 50 in increments of 10. The points in choice C are evenly spread out horizontally, and evenly spread out in the region between negative 2 and 2 vertically.
